intro: Cyanea lobata var. hamakuae, commonly known as the Hawaiian sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate in shape, and the plant is known for its ability to thrive in saline and coastal environments. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing nectar for native pollinators.
